Reviews.Title: “Fantastic team”
Reviews.Author: dragon15
Reviews.Content: London Edgeware could not do enough for us. Helpful and considerate especially at breakfast times with the children. It was good being able to park then walk to the Tube station also. All the team seemed happy to serve and give help in any way when we asked. Room as usual was comfortable wit fresh towels every day when we needed them (usually do with children!). Free 30 mins wifi allowed me to network with friends. Would recommend this i

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Aerdna1881
Reviews.Content: I've been to several Premier Inns in London and this one is one of the best. Check-in was easy, but there was no check-in machines, so you have to do it the old-fashioned way, at the counter - no problem. Yes, this hotel is a bit out of the way from central London, but is easy to get to via tube and bus. My room, which faced the parking lot was large, clean, and the bed was very comfortable. The whole place has no smell, which I find quite important. The bathroom shower was powerful and the liquid handsoap/shower gel dispensers worked as they should (in some PI's we've had trouble getting the gel out). All in all, a very good place to get some comfortable sleep and a nice hot shower.

Reviews.Title: “Home from Home”
Reviews.Author: Richard H
Reviews.Content: Just stayed here for first time, spent one night in family room. All staff encountered were really helpful and very nice with nothing seemingly too much trouble. Breakfast was buffet style, first time in Premier Inn encountered that, but was top notch and choice was plentiful. Had evening meal there also which was also excellent quality, good portions and reasonably priced. Room was very clean and ample space for three. Excellent location, just 10 mins off the M1 and 10 mins walk to tube station. Mr Hall Derbys

Reviews.Title: “Excellent friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: ajplap
Reviews.Content: Spent one night here and wish it was more. Great staff on reception and in restaurant. Breakfast excellent and room large and quiet (ask for top floor and end of corridor. ) The best Premier Inn we have stayed in. Restaurant attached which makes breakfast a breeze

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful family break”
Reviews.Author: MrsHYorkshire
Reviews.Content: Our first stay in a Premier Inn, with 2 autistic children age 10 and 14, I cannot praise them enough! Wonderful friendly staff, nothing was too much trouble. Spotless rooms (I am an infection control specialist nurse!!!) with clean, comforatble beds. Gorgeous breakfast that filled us until teatime. Lovely food in the restaurant in the evening and the staff let us have the same table each day. Our family room was facing the road but there was no road noise at all besides the odd siren, but hey, this is London. We live in a rural village, and if the noise didn't bother us I really wouldn't worry about it. We will certainly be going back

Reviews.Title: “Great London Premier Inn”
Reviews.Author: TripRaterUK
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 3 times now as it is so conveniently located and priced right. The tube is only a short walk away (or you can get the bus - it goes past right outside!). Staff friendly, buffet breakfast great, you get to have it straight away and get exactly what you want. Only downside is the rather pricey restaurant/bar which also does not have Cider !?? Would be excellent apart from this. Ample Car Parking but unfortunately Premier Inn got greedy and started to charge for it the last time we stayed. Tut Tut.

Reviews.Title: “Good Deal all round”
Reviews.Author: Kevin M
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night and enjoyed the quality of the hotel, its staff and had a great nights sleep. Bus services take you into the center of London and its a good cheap way of a local sightseeing trip.Plus Edgware has some great retaurants and cafes but dont wonder around Burnt Oak late at night, its like another country.

Reviews.Title: “Christmas at the London Edgware Premier Inn”
Reviews.Author: Graham H
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed a 4 night stay at the Inn over Xmas. Good room, friendly / helpful staff, pleasant surroundings. Will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: kkazza69
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights and the room was clean, tidy and comfortable. The staff couldn't do enough to help and made our stay as easy as possible.

Reviews.Title: “Super!”
Reviews.Author: Michael M
Reviews.Content: Although it is about 20 minutes by tube from central London (to the Edgware stop) it is only 10 minutes' walk from the tube station in a safe, if not stunning, area (I walked back alone from the tube station at 11pm with no hint of being disturbed). I found the staff extremely polite and helpful and they clearly had regulars, remembering their names and basic details, which impressed me. Rooms were clean and spacious with standard facilities, and the check out of 12 gives you more than enough time to have a lie-in. Did not find it noisy even though it is near a main road, although I stayed on a weekend, where traffic wasn't too heavy. Breakfast was good. A great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: jocole70
Reviews.Content: Service was excellent but rooms have no air con and hotel is on main road so noise is bad and can't open windows. Did fill survey in whislt there and on web site but never got reply . There policy is if u don't have good stay don't pay but I didn't gear anything but am that sort of person to complain to much but did tell hotel my nights slept was not good

Reviews.Title: “Wembley Winners”
Reviews.Author: earpie
Reviews.Content: We had two cracking weekends in this hotel ! One for the FA Cup Semi Final when City beat United. Then again for the Final when City beat Stoke. Fans of both clubs mixed well, drinking in a friendly environment ! Bar was good rooms comfortable !! Ideal location for trips to Wembley

Reviews.Title: “Car Parking”
Reviews.Author: karl r
Reviews.Content: Car Parking charge is in real small print on the internet, it should be free for guests as it will be apparent in the bill especially if staying for a period of time. Also found the staff found it hard to understand you at times, and most if not all where European, not English. All where very polite with clean and tidy rooms. Excellent food choice for breakfast and dinner, good value for money when your children eat for free for a full paying adult........

Reviews.Title: “comfortable 4 night stay”
Reviews.Author: elizt80
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed for 4 nights in this hotel. The rooms were very clean and well maintained. The room was of decent size and the beds very comfortable. The TV had many channels for free viewing and broadband was available for use in all rooms. I was informed on arrival that if I did not have a good nights sleep then I would get my money back! The perfect place for a raging insomniac! I was travelling alone on business and the hotel conveniently accommodated me with having food in my room. The tube station and a mini-shopping centre was within 10-15 min walk. I really enjoyed my stay at this hotel, the rate was reasonable for London and I would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended..A Real Value for money..”
Reviews.Author: Usman P
Reviews.Content: Premier Inn lives up to its promise of giving good service for a good price. Definitely recommend as a good family Hotel. Usman Parayil and Family

Reviews.Title: “Fairly good value for money”
Reviews.Author: kenekw
Reviews.Content: Nice, clean room. Good breakfast buffet. Really wish they had free internet, iron & fridge in the rooms. These are standard in similar American budget chains.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, good value and excellent staff.”
Reviews.Author: keith h
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel primarily for the location and price. Having never stayed in a Premier Inn before, I was a bit apprehensive to stay in a budget hotel but I neednt have worried. The staff were excellent from the moment we checked in to the moment we left. The room was comfortable and more than adequate for myself, my wife and our six month old son. A cot was provided for us and it was clean, with clean bedding for him, and I had no worries about him sleeping in it (apart from his snoring!!). The only slight complaint is that it is next to a busy road and the road noise in the morning was quite loud. Not the hotels fault but it may be something to think about if you have young children with you, or you like to sleep in. We had breakfast, which was very busy but we were seated relatively quickly and the food was more than enough for a busy days sightseeing in London (its only 10 minute walk to the tube station). We also had an evening meal and, again, the waitress was excellent. All in all, a good place to stay. Thouroughly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent good value hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jasenotts
Reviews.Content: First time I've stayed at a Premier but this one was far superior to any Travelodge I've stayed in. The staff were all very friendly and really did seem to care that you were having a comfortable stay. It was great to find a friendly welcome wenever you came through the door rather than indifferent staff who do not speak. The lady who was supervising at breakfast was extremely friendly and helpful. I had a room on the top floor, on the front, but the traffic noise was not a problem with the double glazing. Whether this would be the same in the summer if I had to open a window I don't know. The wider area all around Edgware seems to be fairly good and the ride outr of central London on the tube or bus passes through some very affluent residential areas, but the immediate surroundings to the hotel, especially Burnt Oak Broadway, is quite run down wirth many closed down shops. However, one night I visited a friend in Hampstead and when returning on the night bus at about 2am I felt quite safe walking the short diastance from the bus stop. This was a great place to stay for just 2 nifghts but if I was staying for longer I think I would find the walk to the tube and the long distance into cental Lodon quite tedious, but then thousands of people do this journey commuting to work every day! This is a great hotel where rooms can be found at a good price. Perhaps it is worth putting up with a 10 minute walk to the tube station and a 30 minute ride into central London for the cheaper prices.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient & Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Mag6458
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at several different Premier Inns and feel that we can rely on the comfort of the rooms. Nice to have freeview digital tv. The staff were very friendly and helpful. This hotel is very easy to access from the north and it is a bonus to have an on-site car park. The tube is not far away making it an easy journey into London.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Fourwelshtravellers
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a typical Premier Inn. I book these a lot for business travel because you know excatly what you are going to get. The hotel was fully booked and many seemed to be return travellers, which says a lot in itself. Yes, it does look a little tired around the edges and will probably need a refurb sooner rather than later, but this is partly down to the fact it is so heavily used. Nevertheless my room was spotlessly clean, the staff were very pleasant and keen to help, and the food in the restaurant was surprisingly good. The surrounding area is busy and my room looked onto the road. However the road noise is minimal at night and didn't disturb my sleep. I see what some reviewers say about the cloud of cigarette smoke around the door. This is a problem with all Premier Inns, however, because they are designed with a narrow entrance door with an ashtray planted beside it. This is something the company should review. My only personal gripe is the cost of internet access. Â£10 for 24 hours is far too steep. Overall this is a very satisfactory hotel for a short business trip to London. It really is a 'working' hotel, so families looking for a hotel for a holiday to London should probably look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: cate8890
Reviews.Content: We had a 2 night stay at this hotel to attend a concert at the Roundhouse in Camden.There is plenty of secure well lit parking,we could see the car from our room.The staff were all friendly and helpful.We had a room on the 3rd floor which was very spacious and clean,large,comfortable bed,nice tv with plenty of channels.The hotel is a good 10 minute walk to Edgware tube station,the surrounding area is not the best but we had no problems walking to and from the station late at night.The only problems we had were with some people being very noisy outside the hotel entrance late one night and also others talking very loudly in the corridor early on Sunday morning,but the hotel cannot be blamed for others inconsideration.Overall i was more than happy with the hotel and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “VERY PLEASED”
Reviews.Author: Steve543
Reviews.Content: This hotel does just what it's there to do - wonderful. It's in a good location, only 10 minutes walk from the tube, and with Â£5.per day parking - fantastic. The rooms are large, clean, and have all required facilities. The beds are big and comfy. We asked for a quieter room that didn't face the road and the staff were very helpful and complied. It's rare to find anywhere quiet in London so this was a real treat. The breakfast are hearty, and leisurely - a great start to a day tripping in our fine capital. The staff on reception, housekeeping and in the bar & breakfast area are ALL smiley and pleasant - it was a really nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to the usual standard”
Reviews.Author: A C
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at many Premier Inns. Their big selling point for me is that they are almost always clean, and you can sometimes get a good price. So it is as a Premier Inn fan that I have to say the Edgware Premier Inn is definately one to stay clear of. The staff were friendly but the room was like a Turkish bath - and this was September! The windows could only be opened a couple of inches, but this didn't matter because the noise on the Edgware Road was never ceasing and the windows had to be kept shut. Not that this reduced the noise much. Premier Inn should put in PROPER double glazing and do something about the air conditioning, or lack of.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, great room.”
Reviews.Author: welshfamilywrexham
Reviews.Content: I must admit once I booked this room for my wife, 5 year old son and myself I thought we would be out in the middle of no-where in a war torn council estate. When you first arrive you would be forgiven for thinking this - but once inside it all changes. The staff on our arrival were so friendly and warm that I was genuinly shocked. Our room was clean, large and perfect for what we wanted. The real gem in Edgeware's crown must be the staff in the resteraunt. The lady at breakfast would bring us what we wanted - even though it was self service and treated us like royalty. Also the lady who served our evening meal should be comended. When they had run out of the children's curry (my son's favorite) they offered him an adult meal - unfortunatly it was a little too spicy for him, but in a flash he had spag bol and a free drink. I can honestly say I have never had such good service from a hotel - and believe me I have stayed in some so called 'posh' places where they could learn a lesson or two from edgeware. Admitedly the tube was a bit fo a walk ( about 10 mins with a 5 year old ) - and the journey from edgeware to central London did take up to 45 mins, but this should not detract from the quality of this hotel. My son and I enjoyed the train rides - and it gave us time to plan our day rather than 'hitting the ground runnig'.

Reviews.Title: “Premier Inn @ Edgware”
Reviews.Author: COSMOSFAMILY
Reviews.Content: My family and I had a great stay there, the staff are all very friendly, helpful and always paying attention to detail. Our room was very large and had hair dryer, kettle and cable TV.

Reviews.Title: “If its hot avoid family rooms”
Reviews.Author: Niglamb
Reviews.Content: My family decided to stay here as you can park your car safely ( there was a charge of Â£5 a day that we did not know about) and take advantage of the local underground station to travel in to London. Our stay coincided with the October heatwave to say the room was hot is an understatement it was like an oven our family room was directly above the entrance, the bar and restaurant with the window of our room open the room filled with the cigarette smoke from the people smoking outside the entrance below. The conversations rising from the bar below were very fruity and we had to close the window to avoid answering difficult questions from our children we could not face a second night of unbearable heat smoke and bar noise so we decided to leave, no refund was offered to us for the parking room hire or breakfast that we had paid for in advance so beware of false promises. The rooms were clean as were the bathrooms. The childrens beds are on the floor and the pillow end is partly under the raised bedside table leaving only half of the pillow area for a head my daughter bumped her head a few times in the night we simply changed the head end to the foot end to fix this problem. Food was good some thing for everyone at breakfast. The service was quick and organised and the rooms were clean. If the weather had not been so hot perhaps this would have been a different review

Reviews.Title: “Very decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lisa Lykke H
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel considering the price. Nothing outstanding but nothing to complain about except maybe there was no air condition but then again I didn't expect that to be necessary in Britain in September. Clean room and smiling staff

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: BournemouthSam
Reviews.Content: this hotel is very good value with friendly staff.Breakfast is excellent & rooms are clean. ,The only thing we were unhappy with was the car park fee five pound a day, We have been to this hotel before and not had to pay . We were not told about this when we booked,

Reviews.Title: “Positively surprised. Would love to come back again.”
Reviews.Author: PHDStudent123
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights, from 23 sept. 2011-25 sept. 2011. Breakfast: excellent. Freshly coocked food, real yummy. Room: modern, clean, comfortable, in very good state. Transportation: very good. Be aware this is a medium class neighbourhood, comprised mostly of inmigrant population (I find no problem at all with this and had no inconvenients). But I point this out, because if your looking for a tourist hotel in the middle of all the attractions, this isnt your place. Tube station is 8 minutes away. Various fast food: Subway, KFC, Dominos, Supermarkets and even a small shopping centre. Overall: came in for a conference on saturday. Rest of time for tourism. If your on a budget, and dont want to sacrifice comfort, cleaness, quality, go with the Premier Inn brand.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value, very friendly staff and very handy”
Reviews.Author: BeckyJS
Reviews.Content: 5-10 minutes walk to the tube so v handy for London. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The room was clean and comfortable. The hotel does not have air con, so it does get warm. Roadside is noisy - ask for a carpark room. The floorboards creak - ask for a third floor room. We'd definitely stay again. Fabulous BYO Afghan restaurant 5 minutes away, as is B&K salt beef cafe. 5-10 minutes drive from M1.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel cheap and cheerful”
Reviews.Author: saba h
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel it was very clean and the room was a great size and te bed was amazing very comfy i would go to any premier inn staff was great too

Reviews.Title: “"We will be back again and again"”
Reviews.Author: caterina b
Reviews.Content: We recommend the hotel to all the traveller, it is excellent for family with children and also for sole person; all the staff is professional and friendly Caterina & Daniele (and our children: Ricky and Bea) from Italy

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, confusing remote”
Reviews.Author: Kayla S
Reviews.Content: When I was visiting from America I stayed in this hotel. It was very nice and clean. I enjoyed my stay despite not being able to figure out the tv. The remote was confusing I could not find the on and off button. The food was good and the staff was nice . The vending machine they have by the elevator was really cool. I would love to stay here again and I had a wonderful trip.

Reviews.Title: “What a fantastic stay”
Reviews.Author: yorkshirepreacher
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a few days. Room spotless. Staff very helpful when it asked for help on local transport and destinations in and around London. Most importantly, staff was very professional and polite. We was made to feel so welcome and relaxed from the moment we arrived. Home from home. I would rate this hotel 10/10 for absolutely everything. Thoroughly enjoyed my stay and will almost definately use again. Location and transport into London centre is one tube ride away which takes you directly into kings cross, where all important tubes cross do that you can visit anywhere with ease. A must to use if you want value, customer service, good hotel room with its own bar if you fancy a night cap and staff which where absolutely brilliant. I would recommend this to anyone and give this A++++ rating. Stop here, you will not regret it. I promise Mr Shann

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Marcia68_11
Reviews.Content: A fantastic 2 night stay with very comfortable beds in an enormous room! The 'kids eat free' breakfast makes it really good value- eat as much as you want. we didn't need lunch! Very attentive staff made this a super break at a fantastic price.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: starlight2
Reviews.Content: Stayed in many around the country and all very good. Reception staff ok but Leila who worked the bar was an asset to the company, smiley, helpful and very pleasant. Rooms were very clean as always but HOT, they had provided fans but still extremely hot. Perhaps this hotel chain should consider aircon as i didn't get a lot of sleep due to this (and it was cool outside).. Nice bathroom . Bed large and very firm, husband loved it! Car parking Â£5 per night not quiet sure why this is but reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant, Cheap, Hotel. Good for all!”
Reviews.Author: 186356Harry
Reviews.Content: Want to stay in London for a weekend or a mid week night? A business man who needs a week stay? Here. Just come back. Amazing. Breakfast is OUTSTANDING. Dinner, slightly pricey, but brilliant. Dont stay in central london, stay here. Tube station 5 minute walk, then 15 minute journey to St. Pancras! COME HERE!!1

Reviews.Title: “Very good would definately recommend”
Reviews.Author: Joane P
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a family sight seeing trip to London. It was situated just a short walk from the Edgeware tube station so ideal. The hotel is spotlessly clean and the staff were all friendly. We had the meal deal and found it excellent value for money. Would definately stay here again when we visit London in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Very handy for London.”
Reviews.Author: geoff l
Reviews.Content: The stay was very good. Location and service spot on and the staff were friendly. The walk to this Underground is less than 10 mins and the area you walk through is safe. We got back one night around 11 and had no worries. On a downer, our room was very hot and a number of guests I spoke with also commented on this. This impacted on our "sleep Quality" rating.

Reviews.Title: “We stayed here for the football at wembley. We will be back.”
Reviews.Author: myself4
Reviews.Content: All the staff were very friendly. Rooms surprisingly cosy and spotless. Great bargains to be had if you book on line.

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel in a handy location”
Reviews.Author: IanBTruro_Cornwall
Reviews.Content: Stayed here as a base for a concert at the Roundhouse. We were pleasantly surprised; there was a good sized car park, all staff members were extremely helpful and friendly our bed was large and comfortable, the breakfast buffet was good and it was only a ten minute walk to Edgeware tube station. The price - for a London hotel - was competitive too. A couple of quibbles. There's no air con in the rooms so it was hot but a fan was provided instead. Also, our bathroom was extremely clean and well equipped if slightly battered. However, for the price we paid we couldn't grumble. All in all a very good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “2nd visit good both times”
Reviews.Author: suepet186356
Reviews.Content: Came with my family including 3 small children, the greeting on reception was as good as I have found in any hotel, staff friendly and helpful, we had evening meal and again staff where superb very good with the children. The lady who is in charge of breakfast has been the same one on both our visits and she is a real gem nothing too much trouble.

Reviews.Title: “Dishonest ,Incompetent and expensive-Â£29 my ****”
Reviews.Author: cblackeyes
Reviews.Content: This is a new low in my extensive hotel experiences. Made a mess of the booking despite phone calls to confirm. Â£125 per night. Broken shower unfixed despite repeated requests to fix it. Unp[leasant incometent, disinterested staff. Very poor soundproofing and needs aircon. Their advice to keep the room cool is to keep the curtains closed during the day? Unacceptable at any price. Premier Inn need to wake up or they will be deservedly going bust.

Reviews.Title: “"The Swans loved it"”
Reviews.Author: lisagim123
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed here before we went to Wembley Stadium.... For the two nights we stayed it was clean,tidy & the staff are so willing to help you, to make your stay so comfy!!! I felt like I was in a posh hotel,I certainly got more of a special treatment here than when I did stay in one......Staff are amazing & I would definitely recomened this to anyone and would stay again.....Well done to all who work there you do a fantastic job.......

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Friendly Staff, Huge Family Room”
Reviews.Author: NWGreer
Reviews.Content: Found staff friendly and always willing to help (nothing too much trouble). Room was clean and comfortable as with all Premier Inns, biggest hotel room I have ever seen. Good selection on menu and reasonably priced. For cooked breakfast I liked the self-service. Walk to tube station was ok giving good access to London. Would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: twohatsCumbria
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a recent trip to wembley thought it was excellent value, rooms nice and clean, staff very friendly, made our w/end, hopefully my team reaches final again (carlisle utd) would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly hotel and well positioned”
Reviews.Author: MikeWatt
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a hotel that was on the outskirts of London and this one looked like it would be perfect. The hotel is about 5 minutes drive off of the M1 and about 10 minutes walk from Edgeware tube station. We found the staff extremely friendly and helpful from beginning to end. Room was comfortable and clean. We arrived late and there was no food available at the hotel, the receptionist provided us with a local recommended take away which was open till 0100 and provided a good meal. Other benefits of this hotel are the parking which is secure and cost Â£5 for 24 hours parking, paid in the hotel and only way of exiting is with the paid card or by authorisation from reception. I needed to travel to King Cross Station and this took about 30 minutes at Â£8 for a return ticket, which in my opinion made this hotel the perfect place to stay for access to the city without having to drive all the way in.

Reviews.Title: “Completely satisfied”
Reviews.Author: Awarely
Reviews.Content: The Premier Inn at Edgware is a fine place to stay. Fran in reception was very friendly and helpful, and the room was made available to us very early in the morning, even though check in is not until 2 PM. We loved our stay. The tube station is a hike, but nothing which is impossible. The location really is far from central London, but we wanted a bargain rate and had no car and found it convenient. Tube is at north end of the Northern Line so no problem finding a seat in the morning. Coming back can be a different story, of course. There is car parking for a fee, and a restaurant on site. We did not eat there, but presume it is up to usual high standards of Premier Inns. They have a satisfaction guaranteed policy, which we appreciate, even though we have never had to use it. Internet is 10 pounds extra for 24 hours, a bit steep but with the cheap room rate not a problem. All in all, we were quite satisfied. Only minor complaint--typical UK bathtub which was slippery and not really flat to stand in while taking a shower. Plenty of hot water, however, and the room was large and convenient otherwise.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel but not the best location”
Reviews.Author: Humpo1646
Reviews.Content: The hotel is fantastic. Huge room with the same size bed. Exceptionally clean and well presented. We booked the meal deal which means room, three course meal and breakfast in the morning. The three course meal was amazing, great choice of starter as is the main meal and pudding. We had a drink of choice to go with the meal and when it was served it was more than ample of a portion..yum !! Breakfast the following day is an all you can eat with a vast selection of cereals, dry fruit, bread and the usual other bits and bobs. You have until 11am to have breakfast so that lie in is a blessing. The down side to the hotel is that it is located in an area that's not the best. If you go out and turn left your confronted with the well off area, if you turn right you fund all the shops but the undesirables to go with it. We were here for a house warming having travelled from the north. The house we visited was in this direction and whe I saw a large gang of blokes stood on a corner giving me and my wife a funny look followed up by another bloke thinking he was Bruce Lee an taking action against a council bin, I decided maybe it would be best to vacate the area as soon as possible. Ok this is the hotels fault and there is nothing they can do about (or can the police as they are either sorting idiots out who riot in London or they face pay cuts or job losses) Overall we would stay here again but would take a taxi to wherever we neededto go.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel-Poor location”
Reviews.Author: earlydawes
Reviews.Content: Stayed with work colleagues for two Saturday nights in Feb 2011. As with most Premier Inns, which we stay at regularly, the comforting factor is that you know what you are getting, there are no nasty surprises. Rooms tidy, beds/pillows okay, bathroom facilities good. Breakfast was usual spread with pastries/fresh fruit salad, free to use coffee machine with choice of Latte/Cappochino etc Service good, Reception Staff exceptional, and friendly. Our concern during the two visits was the local area. I would not encourage visitors to explore the area in the evening. Apart from multitude of takeaways, local pubs were on the dodgy side. Bar at Premier Inn served better Stella anyway! My only complaint to report was a piece of chewing gum greeted me on the skirting board in the bathroom, hence the low score on cleanliness, otherwise bedroom was clean-easily missed i guess?

Reviews.Title: “Stay here!!”
Reviews.Author: TonsbergBlues
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at several hotels in London during the years but Premier Inn Edgware is by far the best hotel I've stayed at. The staff is very service minded and will go out of their way to ensure you have a pleasant stay. We asked for an additional duvet and it was delivered to our room within 5 minutes. If you're ever in London and don't mind staying a 25 minute tube ride outside the city centre I could not recommend this hotel any stronger Stay here! The rooms are very spacious and spotless clean. The bed is king-size and really comfy. Bathroom is a bit small, but spotless clean, nicely decorated and even had a tub. The selection of TV channels avalible was by far the best I've ever experienced at a hotel ever and there was a water boiler with coffee and tea avalible in the room. We really enjoyed our room! Breakfast was lovely. The breakfast staff was friendly and extremely proffesional. There was a wide range of choices and gave us a perfect start on our day. We booked in advance and got our rooms for Â£39 pr. night and this was good value. I will stay here again in the future, no doubt. Just very satisfied with Premier Inn Edgware. Thank you for a perfect stay!

Reviews.Title: “Best Premier Inn I've been to”
Reviews.Author: tedotedo
Reviews.Content: I chose this Premier Inn because it was near to my family in Hendon. The bedrooms are very clean and comfortable and the beds are wonderful. The bathroom was very clean, a bit small but suited us fine. This hotel is quieter than the hotels in central London which are always very busy, which is nice. For breakfast they have cereals, yoghurts, muffins, fruit juices and the full English breakfast with sausages, bacon, eggs, toast, baked beans etc. It always tastes good every time. It's about 10 minutes walk from Edgware tube station where it's a comfortable 30 minutes or so to central London and 25 minutes to Camden Market. There is also a shopping centre within walking distance which is handy. We have never had any problems at this hotel and we are going back there soon to stay there again. The staff are always very helpful. The Premier Inn London Edgware is an excellent hotel and I can recommend it to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Very impressed!”
Reviews.Author: marieG24
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 1 night in October, booked 2 rooms as there was 6 of us. We chose this hotel as it was a great price and great location - about 8 mins to tube station then about a 25min comfortable journey into London. This is my first experience of a Premier Inn and i must say enjoyable. We arrived about 1.20pm and we could check in straight away, our room was very big - 1 king size and then two single floor beds either side for the kids. The bathroom was compact but fine. TV in room with freeview (good for the kids whilst we showered). Free parking. We had an evening meal here too as we paid Â£21 per adult for the 3 courses + drink + breakfast. Evening meal choices were fine and the food was of a good standard. The breakfast in the morning was buffet style - cereal, croissants, yogurts, fresh fruit etc. Then you can choose from hot food - sausages, fried/scrambled egg, tomatoes, mushrooms, bacon, beans, toast and drinks. Very helpful staff - made my daughter boiled eggs! All in all an excellent stay and a fab price!

Reviews.Title: “Great for me”
Reviews.Author: Nessy92
Reviews.Content: The room was awesome, with big double bed. Cleaned everyday no matter how big mess I've left hehe. And the breakfasts were great !

Reviews.Title: “Like coming home”
Reviews.Author: Mytime51
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel twice within the month of May, it was convenient for visiting relatives in Burnt Oak. I loved everything about this hotel, from the moment i walked in , speaking to the very helpful Polish girls on reception. I had arrived early, they managed to find me a room that was already for me to check into (before midday). They also looked up some train timetables for me, nothing was too much for them to do. Then when i went up to the room (thought it was going to be noisy, as hotel on Edgware Road)....it was lovely & quiet. I was given a room facing the other direction, away from the road. I could even open the window & hear no noise....lovely. The view out of the window (was pleasant enough, for a busy area), looked onto residental houses & gardens. The bed was a Kingsize bed & very comfortable. The room was a nice decent size, plenty of space to spread out. The bathroom was a bit small, but everything was lovely & clean & worked fine. Overall the room was spotless! I ate breakfast on both occasions in the the (had a nice atmosphere like a country inn) restaurant downstairs. A buffet breakfast, with plenty of choice of cereals, juice & hot foods etc. The standard of the cooked food was good, not greasy at all. The staff were really helpful, especially Portcia (sorry not sure about spelling her name), she even offered to cook my toast & make a pot of tea for me. I found staying here was a very postive experience from every member of the staff. I have stayed in a lot of hotels around the world & would be hard pushed to find one as good as this . The staff go out of their way to help you, which really makes me want to return.

Reviews.Title: “Check in staff cluless!”
Reviews.Author: nicktzovanos
Reviews.Content: I tried to check in last night and their system was down. The guy at the desk allocated my room from a list of names from a piece of paper. After about half an hour he gave me a room and when I entered the room I found a young couple siting on my bed! I whent back to the reception desk and the dim wit standing there took an other 10 minutes to work out that the room belonged to somedody else. Aparently my surname begins with the same letter as the couple sitting on the bed. I pointed out the rest of my name is totaly different so he gave me an other room and said "touch wood this time". Nice room but dim wit staff. Avoid....

Reviews.Title: “Salvation”
Reviews.Author: hampstead88
Reviews.Content: We had to come and stay after some fire damage to our house forced us to looking for something affordable and accessable to central london off the northern tube line link. Parking is inclusive should you stay and the rooms are very competative for their rate versus the local competition. We would reccommend the staff for their big smiles and can do attitudes. I noticed there was a comment about the lack of lunch which was for us to an issue however it seems they have taken this issue to heart and they offered us home made sandwiches and paninis at a great price. Glad we stayed here.

Reviews.Title: “What? No sandwich”
Reviews.Author: YorkshireYork
Reviews.Content: I thought all Premier Inn's would be all the same, but it appears not as they all have local different policies I guess? Anyway, clean and spacious room (although I got a disabled room, don't know why but had to squat under the shower as I'm 6 ft). Plus points, food was VERY good, very helpful and fast staff service, breakfast was self serve and again, VERY good. Bad points, either noisy other occupants or thin walls and floors, I didn't get much sleep, those next to me was noisy (I think upstairs they had a pogo stick). But as I was working on nights, I was annoyed that a menu in my room stated that sandwiches was available. And at noon I tried to order one, the bar staff said "we don't do Sandwiches"?? May sound trivial, but working nights you tend to want to eat light at different times as a result, maybe they should just bin that room menu?

Reviews.Title: “VERY HAPPY WITH THE HOTEL AND THE SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: cinderellaxx
Reviews.Content: Edgware was clean and tidy, the staff were very welcoming. the food was excellent. The bed was very comfy, and the room was clean and fresh. very happy with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable room”
Reviews.Author: inja48
Reviews.Content: The hotel is good for a short visit. Bathrooms are small, beds comfortable, basic accommodation. The hotel is on a main road and I would think the rooms facing this street would be very noisy. Fortunately the room I had was facing the car park. This hotel chain seems to be used by business men and it is ideal for that, not for long stay tourists. It is located within easy walking distance of Edgware Tube station,.

Reviews.Title: “Another pleasant Premier Inn”
Reviews.Author: westlife07
Reviews.Content: Used as a stop over between Devon & Luton airport! As with previous stays at various Premier Inns, very pleasant stay. Rooms clean, comfortable and bright. The two Polish girls on reception on arrival were very friendly, they were especially pleased to hear that our final destination was a short break to Poland. Breakfast very good, serve yourself at this one, but plenty of choice. Lovely coffee from the machine. Asked for a room at the back of the hotel, as a previous reviewer had commented it was quieter, can agree with that. Would definately stay again if I was in the area.

Reviews.Title: “this hotel left me cold,tired & hungry”
Reviews.Author: irishrover39
Reviews.Content: i stayed at this hotel on saturday 30th jan for 1 night,booked it because it was the only hotel really in the area i needed to be in,pricewise it seemed fine Â£62 for a twin room for me and my brother room only.i decided to include all you can eat breakfast for an extra Â£15.50 for the 2 of us(big mistake).room seemed fine,it was clean& tidy as was the bathroom with plenty t.v channels and a kettle with tea & coffee supplied,prolem only started when we went to bed that night,room was cold so i switched on the heater,room started to get warm and heater went off,after getting out of bed and switching it back on a couple of times i realised it was timed to go off after 5 mins and so we spent a fairly sleepless night freezing our bums off.we then went down for breakfast in the morning and being irish were looking forward to a big fry up,there was a good selection of bacon,sausages,mushrooms,fried or scrambled eggs only problem was it was all totally inedible,everything tasted foul and cold,i ended up having tea &toast,on checking out i politely told the nice foreign receptionist all of my complaints when she asked how my stay was and wasn't even offered a refund on the breakfast,Â£15.50 for tea and toast,i don't think even the ritz would charge that.i don't know if all premier inns are the same but i definitely don't recommend this one to anybody.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT!”
Reviews.Author: TTgirl60
Reviews.Content: My daughter & i stayed here for 1 night. We had the biggest room in the hotel. We booked a twin room and our room had 2 double beds. It was nice & clean. My only gripe would be that you could hear the people in the room above us walking around and also the people below us could apparently hear us, so the floors must be very thin. A short walk to the tube station and as it was snowy & icy we got a taxi back which only cost us Â£3.60. Lovely breakfast, good choice of hot & cold buffett. Staff were very friendly. Would definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Service and dinner could be better but excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: dselvan
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights for business. Chose the breakfast and dinner package which came to Â£98 per night which was the most expensive i have paid for a premier inn. Check in was swift but they did mess up the reservation and wanted to cahrge me extra Â£7.50 for breakfast but after they rechecked they found that i have already booked it as part of my package. The corridors can only be accessed with your room card which is good. The same card is also used to enter and exit the car park. But the card failed after one night and had to be reset!!! Dinner was adeqaute with reasonable choice including a drink but next time if i stay, i would just walk 5 minutes down the road since there seem to be some restaurants there which probably serve better food. Breakfast was good with cooked and continental choice (different rates) and the hostess was extremely customer orientated and couldnt do enough. The rooms are standard premier inn affair with comfortable bed and pillows and TV. Second night i stayed there was woken up at 3 am by some alarm which kept going till 7 am and so didnt sleep well, but on basis of their good night guarantee i was refunded a nights stay which was excellent customer service. Overall would recommend for a short trip since comfy rooms with free parking but would look for special deals since room alone at nearly Â£75 is quite expensive for a premier inn.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant!”
Reviews.Author: ALEXW1993
Reviews.Content: Stayed twice now, very convinient for central london, (only 40 min tube ride away) with FREE on-site parking, and and only 10 mins slow walk away from Edgware tube station! Excellent service, great rooms, and brilliant Breakfast. I was most impressed with the staff. We arrived in Edgware at around 10.00am. we got there and were hoping to leave our bags, as it was way to early to check in, as that was not untill 3.00pm! We reported to reception, explained we were going to the London 2012 party in the Mall. The receptionist then went off, and pleasantly told us that she would get someone to clean the room, so we could check in, and not have to come back from central London! This i found to be exeptional from the staff! Thanks for a great stay

Reviews.Title: “Great staff - shall stay again.”
Reviews.Author: Frize
Reviews.Content: Used to only prefer top rated hotels like hilton, radisson or thistle ...was very pleasantly surprised by this one. Booked lasminute and was driving. Parking was free, the room was big, bathroom was nicely kept, but the staff made all the difference for me - they were very friendly, helpful, nice manners as one would find in a top hotel. Will stay again. Thanks guys

Reviews.Title: “Very clean, large comfortable rooms with helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: J0n99
Reviews.Content: Very clean, large comfortable rooms, with good facilities. Helpful, friendly staff. Good continental breakfast with very good choice - porridge recommended. Only problems fixed shower head and awkard to get out off bath/shower.

Reviews.Title: “humiliated by hotel staff”
Reviews.Author: whiteswansea
Reviews.Content: We had continental breakfast for Â£5.25 per person because we don't eat fatty food and didn't buy premier breakfast with sausage and bacon. when we paid for our breakfast, a member of staff gave us suspicious look and asked " are you sure you didn't have premier breakfast?" It was the worst humiliation we had ever had and the staff looked down on us for buying only continental breakfast. We paid Â£225 for 3 nights and were humiliated by a staff for the sake of Â£2 more breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Standard hotel....”
Reviews.Author: dylan292008
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 days and picked it due to the fact it was on the underground but had ample free parking. The hotel was easy to find- straight off the M1. It is a 10 minute walk to the underground- Northern Line, Edgware. And a 10 minute bus ride to Collingdale underground. We got a pass for the bus and underground, so we got the bus sometimes- just because we were lazy!- as the stop was right outside the hotel. Bus number 303, 142 to Collingdale underground on the Northern line. The hotel is well lit and accross the road from numerous shops, takeaways etc. we opted for the breakfast at 7 pounds a night- very good, full cooked with vege option and plenty of cereals, juices etc... worth the money. The room was large with clean linen and carpets. tv and phone, good bathroom with towels and shampoos etc. The only problem we had was, it was FAR to hot in the room- no air con, and you couldn't open the window. It was hard to get a good nights sleep because of the heat which left us abit tired in the morning....we complained to the desk who gave us a fan- it didnt work....I can handle the heat but this was unbearable- for this reason we wouldn't stay here again. Shame really as everything elso was good. cost us 70 pounds night with breakfast for the room.

Reviews.Title: “Nearly full marks.”
Reviews.Author: TheCursedVagrant
Reviews.Content: Never stayed in a Premier before, so unsure of what to expect. I was not disappointed though. Excellent staff who seemed genuine and extremely helpful. The room was average size for a chain hotel but the bed was huge and really comfortable. Bathroom nice and clean and everything worked. Brilliantly powerful shower! Last time I was in London on business I stayed in a Jurys but this room was much better and quieter. Having free and secure parking was also a bonus. I ate in the bar and this was where I deducted marks. I ordered a typical burger type bar meal, which was delicious by the way, and was offered "any sauces to go with that" I said yes to two that were offrered. Foolishly I expected these to be either free, as in any burger chain, or for a minimal charge. I was charged Â£ 3.50! This increased the price of a bar meal at around Â£10.00 by 35%! Bad practice, I think. What a shame because otherwise I would have given the hotel top marks for a budget stay in London. Breakfast was fine with plenty of choice and hot food cooked to order. Checkout smooth and quick.

HotelInfo.Name: Premier Inn London Edgware
HotelInfo.Address: 435 Burnt Oak Broadway | Edgware, London HA8 5AQ, England
